verses.roman:
yadyapi viccheda doṅhāra sahana nā yāya
tathāpi daṇḍavat kari' calilā rāma-rāya

synonyms: yadyapi—although; viccheda—separation; doṅhāra—of both of them; sahana—toleration; nā—not; yāya—possible; tathāpi—still; daṇḍavat—obeisances; kari'-offering; calilā—departed; rāma-rāya—Rāmānanda Rāya.
translation: Although neither could tolerate the other's separation, Rāmānanda Rāya nonetheless offered his obeisances to Lord Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu and departed.
